thread.title: Columbus Crew earn spot in semis with 5-0 rout of DC United
thread.title_full: Columbus Crew earn spot in semis with 5-0 rout of DC United

title: Columbus Crew earn spot in semis with 5-0 rout of DC United
text:
Columbus Crew earn spot in semis with 5-0 rout of DC United The Crew secured a first-round playoff bye and a spot in the East semifinals. Post to Facebook Columbus Crew earn spot in semis with 5-0 rout of DC United The Crew secured a first-round playoff bye and a spot in the East semifinals.  //on.wusa9.com/1S5msBx   Join the Conversation To   Columbus Crew earn spot in semis with 5-0 rout of DC United Associated Press, AP 1:22 a.m. EDT October 26, 2015 Oct 25, 2015; Columbus, OH, USA; D.C. United goalkeeper Bill Hamid (28) dives but can not make the save during the second half versus the Columbus Crew SC at MAPFRE Stadium. The Crew won the game 5-0. Mandatory Credit: Joe Maiorana-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Joseph Maiorana, Joe Maiorana-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) - Jack McInerney scored in the 25th minute and Ethan Finlay added a pair of second-half goals a minute apart as the Columbus Crew wrapped up second place in the MLS Eastern Conference with a 5-0 victory over D.C. United on Sunday. 
The Crew secured a first-round playoff bye and a spot in the East semifinals. 
It was the most lopsided victory for Columbus since a 6-1 win over Tampa Bay during the 2001 season. 
United could have claimed a first-round bye by beating a Columbus side playing without two players. Kei Kamara, the MLS leader in goals scored, and Federico Higuain both were suspended for the finale due to an accumulation of yellow cards. 
Columbus led 1-0 at halftime and broke it open in the second half. Justin Meram scored in the 54th minute to make it 2-0, and Aaron Schoenfeld tallied in the 80th. Read or Share this story: http://on.wusa9.com/1S5msBx TOP VIDEOS
